page.title: 08Carlton Anglican Church
page.content: St. Mary's Anglican Church is an attractive l9th Century building which stands on the corner of Church Lane and the High Street, roughly in the centre of the village.The present vicar, The Rev.M.Warchus has been the vicar for the past l4 years.The vicar serves the parish of Carlton which also includes the churches of Drax and Camblesforth.The site was first occupied by the original chantry chapel dating from the l4th Century. The Chapel was made of wood and burnt down, but it was rebuilt in l688 and then again in l862. The present church will seat a congregation of approximately l5O people.It also has provisions for a choir,but unfortunately there is no longer one.
